Reviews.Title: “Best in Madrid!”
Reviews.Author: KristanSCHU
Reviews.Content: The service is very friendly and helpful. The breakfast is wonderful and the location is perfect. It is within walking distance of so many things and easy to get to main metro stations. The rooms are very clean and spacious. I would recommend this to anyone travelling with large groups. I have been travelling to Madrid for many years now with school groups and they are always very accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “A happy stay in Madrid.”
Reviews.Author: Ronalie F
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a lovely place to say in this Madrid! Our apartment or suite was well appointed, spacious and spotlessly clean. It also had cooking facilities and a large fridge. While the decor was not luxurious, it was comfortable and more than adequate. The bathroom was excellent and the bed wonderful. The traveller who wrote that the apartment was noisy must have had the windows constantly open, because we slept like babies and one could not hear any noise from the bedroom whatsoever. It is true that there are about ten stairs to negotiate from the lobby to the elevators, and we do not travel lightly, however the staff immediately offered assistance. If you walk outside and cross the street you are able to walk through the stunning Jardines de Sabatini and exit opposite the Plaza de Espana or near the Royal Place and then wander through the heart of this beautiful city. My only complaint would be that there is a charge of 30 Euro to use the washing machine. I expect a charge however not so much. Overall I would recommend the hotel and would certainly stay here again. We are loving every moment of our stay in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, tidy and remarkable...”
Reviews.Author: Alxender W
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quite clean and tidy. Our room was big. They offer use of kitchen within the room for 10.00 euro deposit, which they return on checkout. Bathroom was huge and our room has terrace also. I saw another review saying "it is the best hotel in Madrid". May be from somebody who is overwhelmed by the services etc. It may not be a best in whole Madrid, but definitely it is remarkable. Nice view of Royal Place from the terrace. Two metro stations at 5 to 10 minutes distance. Shopping area at nearby locations. When we talked to some other guests in lobby, they told us that there was some odor in their room, but we didn't feel that in our room. And we kept the window closed because it was noisy for whole night due to the busy traffic on the road.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable stay in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Riduan
Reviews.Content: It was a fantastic 1 week stay at Apartosuite Jardines de Sabatini for me & my family. We were given a room on of the top flour suite, facing the Palacio Real de Madrid (The Royal Palace of Madrid). The room is very spacious and fully equipped with all the necessity, including kitchen for light cooking. There are also balcony space to enjoy the view, but at time it can get very chill due to the winter weather. Breakfast was also good with variety of selections, as expected. The staff were warm & friendly too. Do also check out the Solarium on the top floor, which give you a nice place to relax and enjoy the view of the Royal Palace & Part of Madrid city. Location wise, was also great it few block away from either Principe Pio or Plaza De Espana Metro stations. It's is not too busy like Sol or GranVia, but within close proximity of them. It's also possible to walk to Gran Via & Sol. In fact we did it 3 times during our stay, enjoying the entertaining street performers, some shopping & appreciating the lively Madrid city along the route. The most distinct thing about this hotel, are the great service and warm receptions of the staff. They are ever willing to provide assistance, and always there to help carry our bags or baby stroller, providing directions, asking us if we need any assistance and help us makes booking to make our stay in Madrid a very memorable one. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Fine, but do not expect too much”
Reviews.Author: DDandC
Reviews.Content: Based on previous reviews we expected something really good. But the place is just average, nice if you like really bare and minimalist setting. It manages to achieve an appealing impression with the very least of furnishings. Colorful lobby is attractive visually but includes many steps before you can reach the elevator, no help with luggage. The suite we had was the more expensive one, on the fifth floor, with a view of the royal palace. This was nice, plenty of space for our family of three. Yet our bedroom faced a very small light well, there was a constant unpleasant odor which did not really make it a place we wanted to relax in. Our living room faced the street but we had to keep those windows closed because of constant and overwhelming traffic noise. Very nice and modern bathroom, but although it was clear that there were three of us in the suite we consistently kept getting too few towels. Cleaning staff kept using guest elevators at breakfast time as if that was the most normal thing. Keep in mind that this is not a proper hotel, so many services are not offered. Location is ok but not the best for you have to walk about ten minutes along a very busy street to reach the metro. Reception was very forthcoming with advice on places to visit but almost none of those turned out to work for us.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in madrid”
Reviews.Author: Chen Zhen Tai 陈
Reviews.Content: Best location Best service Good breakfast Everyone in this hotel is friendly Helpful And make our family happy all the time When i back to madrid This no.1 in my mind

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel for families - look no further”
Reviews.Author: globetraveler7
Reviews.Content: Other reviewers have already covered the basic facts of this wonderful hotel: new, spectacular view, modern, functional. What I really like is that after I came down to check out and I told them that they were #10 in Madrid on trip advisor, they did not even know!!! So, these wonderful people are doing a fantastic job just for the sake of doing a great job. As the fate would have it, by the time I sat down to write this review, they climbed to spot #7! A couple of other details: everything really works in the hotel, rooms are quiet (even though we were facing the street) and pleasantly spacious and more than enough for a family of four. Now that I have seen what it is like to have a fully equipped kitchen, I do not understand how I was surviving with family in other hotels before! Simply put, if you are coming with the family to Madrid, look no further and simply come here. No place is perfect, and the *only* minor issue with this place is that there is a set of stairs without a ramp for strollers. but, the front desk staff always promptly runs to your help and carry the stroller with or without you.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay with snag”
Reviews.Author: Lynne K
Reviews.Content: This is a modern, clean hotel located near the beautiful Palacio Real and close to both the Plaza Espana and Principio Pio Metro stops (both of which have elevators). However, I troubled over what to rate it. We were given a room on the 2nd floor. They are lucky enough to be able to be renovating right now and were doing so on the second floor. Unfortunately, this led to an awful chemical/off-gassing smell within the hallway. I thought it was significantly better in our room (although not completely gone) but my husband, who is more sensitive was very bothered by it. We asked to move, but they said they were booked full. When we returned our second night late and hoping to hose down the children, we found brown water in all the faucets. (Maybe again from the construction, although I can't be sure.) However, at this juncture, the staff responded extremely quickly, with apologies, and moved us to a room on the sixth floor. They even actually carried much of our stuff up there and then also gave us a free breakfast (which was delicious, but dieters be warned). There was no smell at all and no problem with the water on floor 6 and after that our stay was perfect. The staff also checked in on us again later. So this is a modern, clean, new hotel, with huge rooms well suitable for a family of four, with an excellent view of Palacio Real and with very courteous hotel staff (warm and friendly from the start - excellent English), but with the catch about the construction. I do recommend others staying here for sure, especially families, but would definitely suggest calling and requesting a room on the 5th, 6th, or 7th floor for the time being.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable Location”
Reviews.Author: DemonJohn
Reviews.Content: We stayed here together with our 17 year old son for 6 nights in early January. Having emailed our arrival details it was very pleasant to be met at the door by the reception lady. The apartments were very easy to find using the advice from previous reviewers. Take the Metro to Plaza Espana, walk down the hill and you are there. We had a front apartment on the fifth floor. The view of the palace was memorable. The apartment was very comfortable. The kitchen was well equiped although you have to pay a 10 Euro deposit for the cupboard key which is a bit unusual but this was refunded on departure. We would certainly stay here again. The staff are especially helpful. It was an easy walk to Mercato San Miguel which is a great place to eat and drink.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in every way”
Reviews.Author: Carmela60_11
Reviews.Content: Great location, near everything and quiet at the same time. Splendid room - rather an apartment, really, with big living-dining room with kitchenette, spacious bedroom and bathroom. Stylish decoration. Spotlessly clean. Good breakfast too. Efficient and welcoming staff. Really loved it, will return if possible.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Great Rooms”
Reviews.Author: AndreaSousa28
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel recently on my visit to Madrid. The hotel is in a great location right across from the Palacio Real. The room themselves were great and stylish. They were spacious and they little kitchenette was great since I was traveling with a 1 year old. The staff on the other hand was a hit or miss, either extremely rude or very helpful (maybe that just happened during the couple of days I was there). I would definitely recommed this hotel to everyone

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely a great place to stay !”
Reviews.Author: Harry_Grouse
Reviews.Content: We booked Aparto Suite Jardines de Sabatini for 6 nights in the Summer of 2011 and that time there wasn't many reviews available. We absolutely loved this place in every way and it will go our personal TOP 3 list of the best price / value hotels where we have stayed in Europe during the recent years. Everything was just perfect for us and the private roof terrace was an incredible extra. We could hear live classical music every evening from the palace concerts while having a class of wine in our private balcony facing the palace. Hopefully they will keep this place like it was the time we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish hotel and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Luca_Luo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is between the subway station Principe Pio and Plaza de Espana. Each station about 5 to 10 minutes walk. The hotel staff provided a useful tip: if you come from the subway station to the hotel, please get off at the station Plaza de Espana. If you are going out from the hotel to the metro station, please go to the station Principe Pio. Because the road in front of the hotel is downward from the Plaza de Espana to Principe Pio. We stayed on the top floor of the hotel and have a room with a terrace. We have a nice view of the royal palace. The room is stylish and spacious. The combination of black, white and orange color is delightful. The bathroom is also spacious and clean. For using the kitchen in the room, you need to pay 10 EUR deposit which can be get back when checking out. The kitchen in the room has all the basic stuffs such as frying pan, knife & folk, spoon, plates and etc. The only thing is that there are some smell from the sink in our room. There are several small supermarket and restaurants beside the hotel. The royal palace is just cross the road. The location of the hotel is nice. The hotel staff speaks very good English and provide helpful tips for sightseeing in Madrid. We enjoy our stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great service,beautiful boutique hotel and great Location”
Reviews.Author: Lustig_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel last weekend for 4 night.The service was very helpful and kind.The location was perfect,we almost didn't use the metro...main places of interest are in a walking distance.The first 2 days we got a beautiful suit on the first floor on the back of the building so we enjoyed silence....than we moved to a very nice room on the 6th floor facing the palace which was amazing.We also liked the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Location and service”
Reviews.Author: idus1926
Reviews.Content: The hotel is excellently located, has free parking and the service is unfailingly curteous and promp. Whatever we asked for, the consierge was there to help. The free internet orked well.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: Poketlynnt
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from Saturday to Wednesday and then returned on Sunday for one night. We stayed on the top floor in the suite with a terrace facing the Palace Real. The view was perfect and we didn't hear any street noise (which was nice, because the hotel is on a very busy street). The room was very spacious - kitchenette, living room with terrace, large bathroom and bedroom with a king size bed. But the decorations are cold and sparse. The floors are slate tiles and there was one area rug that kept sliding all over the place, which was annoying. In the bedroom, there was a large armoire - plenty of room for all of your clothes and shoes - but there was a large area in the middle for a TV and it was empty! Instead there was a small TV on the wall that was half obstructed when the door was open - just weird. The roof deck is very nice - lots of comfortable seating and again the great view. But as others have said, this part of the hotel as well as some others are getting rough around the edges and need some maintenance. Also, the roof deck would benefit from a bar or snack service. There actually was a small bar, but no one was working at it. The location of this hotel isn't bad - it's located right near the Palace and Old Madrid and there are many sights you can walk to. The bus is right outside too. The nearest metro stop is Principe Pio where you can catch the 6 or the 10 train, the shuttle to Opera and even a renfe train. There is also a nice shopping mall attached to the station. Principe Pio is a 5 to 10 minute walk down a hill from the hotel. The only downside is that it's a really smelly street - urine and dirt to the point of being sticky - and it's not so pleasant to walk back to the hotel at 11pm after dinner (or whenever you go back). The street was always busy though, so it didn't feel unsafe. The highlight of this hotel for me was the woman who works the front desk during the day – I think her name was Yurema. She was always willing to do anything to help – carry luggage, make reservations, give directions, etc. She was knowledgeable and friendly. The woman working the desk at night seemed reluctant to answer questions and was knew less about the trains and sights. She was professional, but did not go above and beyond. However, she did make us reservations to an amazing paella restaurant. The last point I have is about cleanliness – when we left the room on Wednesday there was something on the floor. I thought it was a dead bug and didn’t touch it. When we checked back into the room on Sunday, it was still there. Turns out it was a raisin. I don’t know if someone stayed in the room while we were gone, but regardless, the floor was obviously not cleaned properly. I would recommend this hotel for the size of its rooms and the price – it’s a good value. But I would not recommend a room facing the front on a low floor or you will get a lot of street noise.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: pulitzer
Reviews.Content: Clean, well located and great staff.......would definitely stay here again. Good for a family of four.

Reviews.Title: “Not for you if you like a little more than basic”
Reviews.Author: Marti40
Reviews.Content: I opted for this hotel based on all the positive reviews. Just a few points to make note of below: Positives - The room was very spacious with a mini kitchenette (handy if you want to store a few essentials like milk and juice etc.) The location was good if you like a nice long walk - if not look for something on the Gran Via The room was tidy Negatives - Attention to detail was very poor (i.e. parts of the walls near light switches left unpainted, toilet roll holder and bath robe hook both loose, around the bath tub wasn't a very nice sight etc). Not a very cosy/welcoming room Location isn't very nice; you walk out onto a street with a rather unpleasant odour Service is very average (i.e. I went down to request an iron and board and the man at the front desk brought them to the lift and put them both on the floor and walked off). Overall, this hotel is fine if you just want somewhere to sleep and aren't really bothered about having the nice luxuries. But if you're a fussy traveller that likes to have a cosy room to come back to after day of walking/exploring, and you want things like a nice shower, a few good TV channels/room service etc - this is not the place for you. It's not a bad hotel, just doesn't tick the boxes of you like more than basic.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as we'd hoped”
Reviews.Author: Judi E
Reviews.Content: We were a little disappointed with the hotel since we'd read so many positive reviews on Trip Advisor. We booked with Agoda and specified a king bed got a room with 2 twin beds! This was a romantic get away not "Leave it to Beaver" so we went to the front desk. They were apologetic but said they can't guarantee bed size when you book with Agoda. Huh??? That could have been my fault because I read SO MANY reviews and we were visiting 3 cities but bottom line- it was not acceptable. They offered to move us the next day and they did- to a room reeking with SMOKE! Again, we specified non smoking which, again they were sorry they couldn't guarantee. I started to have a melt down and the girl at the front desk was sorry but... when I said I was going to put a review on Trip Advisor she quickly offered up an upgrade. We got a nice suite with a king bed in a non smoking room. Nice save and I'm very appreciative they accomodated us but It was still a pain to pack up and move twice when all I wanted was what I had been promised in the first place! The bathroom in the first room wasn't up to snuff either- I need counters and after looking at the photos of counter space I was disappointed to find a pedestal sink. Breakfast was awful too- we took one look around and left! DO NOT waste your money! We went into a little corner dive about a block up toward the Plaza Espana station and had the most delicious pastry and cafe con leche with the locals. Not fancy but perfect! We also had an interesting dinner at a restaurant Duda (?) about a block away. I would recommend it for a wonderful liquor called manzanillo that they served after dinner. It was the elixir of love! On the positive, the room was clean and large enough and the front desk helpful. It was a good walk to the Plaza Mayor but it was an enjoyable one. The location by the palace was nice too. Bottom line, it was fine but I wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: Queenscliffe
Reviews.Content: Spent 6 days at the apartments in October. Staff were excellent, always helpful and supportive. After our first day we left for a 3 day tour. We were uncertain about the location of tour company's office in Plaze de Oriente. One of the staff members accompanied us right to the office, to ensure that we would be on time for the start of the tour. We returned to the apartments for the balance of our stay in Madrid. Absolutely ideal for our needs. An easy 15 minute walk to Plaza Major. Two metro stations and the Gran Via within 5 minutes walk. A great little bar a 100 metres away on the corner up the hill. A number of site seeing attractions within 5 - 10 minutes walk - Templo de Debod, Royal Palace and San Antonio de la Florida to name a few. The rooftop area was ideal place to relax in the evening with a perfect view of the palace. The room that we had was little dated but in very good condition and very large. Although we rarely used it, to much good food in Madrid, the small kitchenette gives you the ability to prepare simple meals in house if you wish. The room was spotless when we arrived and the house keeping throughout our stay was very good. I have no hesitation in recommending this as a place to stay in Madrid

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: happytrails2uall
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in Sept 2011 and paid $168/ nt USD. The staff was friendly and accommodating the room was spacious, modern and clean. The kitchenette was a nice bonus and we were hoping it would have a coffee maker ...but no such luck. It was a short hike (uphill) to get to the Palacio Real and other sites in Madrid. The solarium terrace was a little tired looking but nice. One night we tried to watch the beautiful sunset up there but the view was obscured by fencing. Overall we had a nice stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Autumn in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: bluemonk6
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for three nights last week and found it excellent. If using the Metro from the airport, get off at Plaza de Espana and turn left towards the Royal Palace and it is about a five minute walk. We had booked a studio room at a special offer rate from a website. However, when we arrived at the hotel we were told that they had upgraded us to a suite at no extra cost. We were to the front of the building with a view from the window directly onto the Royal Palace. The facilities were excellent and very clean. The road outside is busy and there was a lot of traffic but once we closed the bedroom door at night we couldn't hear it at all. The bed itself was firm, as I like it, and the pillows were not too soft. The breakfast room was well stocked in fresh fruits, cereal, juices, breads, meats, etc and is very clean and efficiently run. On arrival I discovered that my mobile phone had been stolen from my pocket on the Metro coming from the airport. Thankfully I was able to use my wife's phone to contact my service provider back home and get the number blacklisted immediately - they did it while I was talking to them on their service line - so the number was useless to whoever had it. I managed to cancel it within 30 minutes or less of it being stolen. We bumped into a lady who explained she was the Duty Manager and she asked how we liked Madrid so far. I explained about the theft and she was very apologetic. I said there was no need as it wasn't her fault and, to be honest, could happen in any city. She said she was sorry to see this happen to visitors to her town and arranged with the reception desk to give me a complimentary call during my stay if I needed to contact anyone at home. She also offered that if I wanted to register the theft with the local police station, she could have the interview done in her office over the phone and just collect the statement later from the station as it would be much quicker than going to the station. I did not take her up on the offer but it was much appreciated and made me feel relaxed to receive this service. The Royal Palace is across the road and a nice way to get to it is through the Sabatini Gardens. From there a short walk through the Oriental Garden brings you to the Opera House and the Plaza de Isablea II provides a short walk to most sights. The furthest attraction is the Prado Gallery and this is easily reached with a 20 minute walk through the bustling commercial area. To be honest, three days is plenty of time if you only intend to see Madrid itself. All in all (apart from the theft) I really enjoyed Madrid and the hotel and its staff played a large part in this as they made our stay so comfortable. I would recommend this as a good place to stay and, by the way, check out the view of the floodlit Palace at night from the roof terrace!

Reviews.Title: “Good location-good value-great staff”
Reviews.Author: WelshBobcat
Reviews.Content: Stayed seven nights. For city breaks we prefer an apartment for a bit more space and facility to do your own breakfast and occasional other meal. Decently equipped studio with solid fixed bed than than fold-up sofa bed. Staff are excellent. Good conveninece store within 50 yards. Really good tapas bar and decent (more upmarket) restauarant within crawling distance. Bus stop outside apartments. Super roof terrace but bring your own drink!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best places i have ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: atcook
Reviews.Content: My partner and i stayed at the Aparto Suite Jardines de Sabatini for 3 nights in Sepember 2011. I had booked and standard room and was given a suite on the 3rd floor. The rooms are huge and very well appointed. We had a huge double bedin a large bedroom. The lounge had a sofa bed that converted into 2 single beds. The kitchenette had a 2 ring hob, microwave and fridge. All the crockery, pans and utensils are provided, but you will have to pay a 10 euro deposit for the key, which is payable at reception. The rooms were spotless, just like the rest of the hotel, there were staff cleaning every time we left or returned to the hotel. The best part is the roof top solarium, it overlooks the royal palace and is such a peaceful haven in the middle of a busy city, great to relax and unwind with a beer after a day sight seeing. The accomodation is perfectly located equidistance between 2 metro stations, principe pio and plaza de espana. Its down hill from plaza de espana to principe pio. Plaza de espana is the best station for arriving with luggage and principe pio when leaving. The accomodation is only a short walk to the city centre and the royal palace and the metro is handy for the museums and art galleries. I would to especially praise the staff at Aparto Suite Jardines de Sabatini, they are wonderful and cannot do enough for you. Any questions do not hesitate to ask them, all the staff i spoke to spoke perfect English and were very knowledgable. I cannot praise this accomodation enough and would return to Madrid just to stay here

Reviews.Title: “Hidden luxury in the heart of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Spiteri
Reviews.Content: I have just spent 5 nights together with my husband and 2 year old boy in this aparthotel. We could not have been more satisfied. We stayed in a double suite on the 6th floor with an incredible view of the Royal Palace. Being so high up, we never heard any noise from the street below. The room, complete with kitchen and living area is very spacious, even with the extra cot. This is a necessity when travelling with young kids. What you see on their website is exactly what you get. The location is excellent. It is about 10 minutes walk from the Royal Palace and Opera, and less than 5 minutes from Plaza Espana (and we travelled with a pushchair). It is also very well served by underground, the closest being Principe Pio and Plaza Espana. Basically it is within walking distance from most attractions without all the hustle and bustle of Gran Via. A special thanks goes to Daniel at reception who was always extremely helpful and even managed to book us a table at the Tablas Flamenco which is just up the road. Great show and shouldn't be missed. Breakfast is a variety of bread, cold meats and cheese, cereals, pastries and yoghurts. Scrambled eggs and baked beans were also available. Nothing extraordinary but more than enough choice in my opinion. Would definitely recommend and would stay again if I was visiting Madrid some other time.

Reviews.Title: “View out My Window was Spectacular”
Reviews.Author: MBZBOY
Reviews.Content: Was on 6th Floor (7th of those of us in US) and had a small balcony. The view was of the Royal Palace, less than 1 block away. The Hotel is located about a quarter mile from the Plaza Espania Metro Station and about a 1/2 mile from another. Both are easy to get to from Airport or Train Station. At first the neighborhood looked a little dicey, but actually very nice. The hotel lobby is small and there are several small sets of stairs to traverse to the elevators, again small by US norms. The hotel is a renovated older building and very nice on the inside. There was additional renovation when I was ther the end of July, 2011. Good room, lots of hot water and again the view. Have the owners daughter show you the car collection. That is worth the price of the room alone. I'm a car guy and was enthralled listening to this lady talk about helping here father work on the cars when she was a little girl, she's now early 40's. She is very knowledgeable and loves the cars. Great Tapas bars close to the hotel, walking distance. Be sure to try the Pigs Ears at La Cervaceria Deportiva (Calle Preciados, 38)

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotel experiences in Europe at a great price”
Reviews.Author: annagiebels
Reviews.Content: Waking up and opening the curtains to reveal a fantastic view of the Palacio Real was one of the highlights of our trip and something I will not soon forget. The location is 500m from the Pio Principe station and within walking distance of some of the most historic sights in Madrid as well as La Latina district with great tapas restaurants and bars. The rooms are modernly furnished and very spacious with a full service kitchen that I used to make breakfast every day. The best thing about the hotel is the service. The staff go out of their way to assist you and offer to take your picture at the solarium on the rooftop, if you wish. Bring up your own wine or beer. It's the perfect place for romantic sunset cocktails to end your day.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect setting and very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: dabstar
Reviews.Content: Aparto Suites provides an excellent base for exporing Madrid. It is situated rigth between two metro stations and within easy walking distance of the old city. Hotel is very nice with modern large rooms and a very friendly staff

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, central but quiet location”
Reviews.Author: TF_555
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and had a very nice experience. We wanted to be quite central, but not in a very noisy street, so this worked well. We were on the top floor, with great views opposite the Palace. The only complaint was a blocked sink which was not fixed despite our complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: blimele
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay in this Apart Hotel in Madrid! Nicely decorated apartments located in front of the Sabatini gardens. We enjoyed our accomodation, the friendly service, the good breakfast. It is a place that we would like to come again in Madrid

Reviews.Title: “Lovely modern appartment style hotel near Royal Palace”
Reviews.Author: jjr864891
Reviews.Content: Aparto Suite is in a good location near Plaza Espana and handily placed to get to Sol. Also near Plaza Oriente which is a lovely place to while away an afternoon. Only disadvantage beimg the need to go through an underpass if walking back from Town at night. The hotel itself has very good sized rooms with a sofa and table area. The kitchenette was well equipped. The terrace was a bit smaller than expected and was overlooking a busy road although the higher floors may have better views. The rooftop solarium is a lovely place for lounging around with excellent views over the city. We were very impressed with Aparto suite and thought it offered a very high standard of luxury for the price.

Reviews.Title: “The only place to stay in Madrid!”
Reviews.Author: MeanderingMaddy
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival the staff told me they like to do something special the 1st day of each month, so they upgraded me from my 37ft double room to a 57ft suite. The suite was outstanding, with an excellent view of the Madrid palace and gardens. This meant I was on the street side, i had no noise problems on the 6th floor. I booked to stay here because I liked the look of the roof-top. It was superb! I was able to entertain some new friends I made from a weekend wedding in Segovia, with local food and drinks in the sunshine. There is an excellent, deli a block up on same side of street, towards Metro Espanga. They are apartments, however, with hotel service. The service was the best I have ever come across. My iPhone was stolen on the metro, and the staff were very helpful with locating police station for me, aiding me in using their computer to print my boarding pass. Also they gave me a morning wake up call. Metro either side within 5 minutes. Gorgeous gardens surrounding palace, and especially on the Segovia side - all free. 5-10min walk to Metro Calle for shopping area. Or 10mins walk across palace gardens to La Latina for Calle Baja, where the best tapas in town are. Very good for bar hopping. For a retro cocktail bar, just known to the locals, Delic, Plaza De La Paja. It was like having a mini holiday in just 24 hours. While I loved the suite, roof-top and views, the staff still stood out as the best asset. I only had one night there as I was in Segovia for a wedding over the weekend. No photos from me, my one week old iPhone stolen.. The photos on the website are an honest representation. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic family friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: derrygerry
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here with our 7 month old baby from the 10th to 14th of March , it was our first trip with our baby and this hotel made it a very enjoyable one. The staff were without a doubt amongst the friendliest and most helpful we have ever encountered( especially the girl who checked us in) , they booked a taxi to take us from the airport ( we needed one with a car seat for the little one) check in was very efficient and the cot was in our room as requested, The room itself was spacious had a proper double bed (instead of the twin beds pushed together that you frequently get on the continent) a good sized bathroom and a kitchenette with Microvave fridge etc. we had saw mention in previous reviews that there was no kettle in the room so we brought a travel kettle with us , the girl on reception had however asked us if we needed a kettle so I assume that they will provide one if required Location wise the hotel is less than a 5 minute walk to Plaza de Espana, and about a 10-15 walk to Puerto del sol ,there is a supermarket ( opencor) and a shopping mall about a 5 minute walk away in principe pio

Reviews.Title: “Excellent rooms, great view, excellent price”
Reviews.Author: AlfredoLP
Reviews.Content: We needed a dozen rooms for a business group, and our secretary negotiated an excellent price for some very nice and spacious rooms -- a real deal. The view on the royal palace from the upper floor rooms is stunning. Only problem is that the street is noisy -- and as my window did not lock perfectly, you could hear the noise creeping into the room. Still, an excellent hotel, located very close to the hearth of Madrid. I will also consider it in the future for personal travel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely roomy apartment, great location and unforgettable staff!”
Reviews.Author: aubergeQuebec
Reviews.Content: We completed our 50th birthday girlfriend trip through Spain in Madrid where we slept 2 nights at the Aparto Suite Jardines de Sabatini. We were extremely impressed by the helpfulness of the staff: from room selection and preference, to organising transportation to the airport or even breakfast before time as we had to leave early. The staff was genially interested in making our stay perfect, this is a rare gift. Also the apartment was really great: space, cleanliness and view wise. Finally the rate was very reasonable as well, mostly considering the big tourism conference happening in Madrid during our stay. The central location permitted us to walk to all major attractions. A great stay, I will surely put the Aparto Suites in my good books for a further stay in Madrid. Thank you to the great staff. (NB another plus: a large room to work or relax on the main floor).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for a beautiful room with mini-kitchen!”
Reviews.Author: TheImmigrant
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotels I've been to so far in Europe. My (standard) room was very simply and elegantly appointed, with a modern feel, and came equipped with a mini-kitchen with sink and stove, as well as a table and chairs, which worked out great when I invited people over. The bathroom also had nice, modern fixtures, although the first time I turned on the shower, it sprayed water everywhere until I figured out how to switch it to the overhead faucet. Wireless internet cost extra, but it worked fine. The neighborhood's not the most exciting, but it's a 5-minute walk to the Plaza de Espana metro, so it's hard to complain. All in all, very impressive, given the relatively low price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice. Still very new and fresh.”
Reviews.Author: JB_glas
Reviews.Content: Couldn't decide whether to book a hotel or a rental apartment in Madrid, and went for this Apart-hotel as a compromise. Really glad I did. The hotel still looks and feels really new, and as such there's very little to find fault with. It might be a bit far out if you want to be in the centre of the action, but I found it ideal to be that bit quieter but still easy to get to all the sights. It was really easy to get there from the airport on the Metro and unless you have a lot of luggage I would recommend the Metro as the quickest and cheapest way. The hotel is only about 5 mins from Plaza de Espana station. The staff were friendly, helpful and efficient. Both checking in and out were simple and quick. Breakfast was adequate, limited choice, but what there was was absolutely fine. The room itself was extremely spacious, the small kitchen was perfect for a short stay. The bathroom was spotless, the beds firm but comfortable. The only minor negatives I can think of are that there was no kettle in the room, which might not go down well with visitors from the UK (but there is a microwave). And that the sound-proofing between the rooms could be better. But all in all, I really liked this hotel, and woudln't hesitate to recomment it. It is MUCH nicer than most 3* hotels and better than many 4*'s I've stayed in. I'd also recommend the Adventurous Appetites tapas tour (reviews on here) as it was a great introduction to the city.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice for families”
Reviews.Author: ItalyMar
Reviews.Content: It is a residence not far from Plaza de Espana, Gran Via and very close to the royal palace and its gardens. The building and the street are not nice but the residence is. The building has been nicely renovated and everything is new. A bright, large and colourful hall will welcome you. There is a large dining room for breakfast and a small reading room is at guests’ disposal. We received a two room apartment which could accommodate four people. Everything was new and fine. The small kitchen had few utensils. They are enough only for a short stay and if you don’t have many necessities. Unfortunately wifi is not free (as expected in such a beautiful residence). It is available in your room but they charge you. The price was really good and I highly recommend the residence.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Spingos
Reviews.Content: The staff here are exceptionally friendly and helpful. The hotel is clean and comfortable, and breakfast (€7) is excellent. The situation is very good, 150 yards from the Plaza De Espana, and even though we had a metro tourist ticket we enjoyed walking back each night from the Puerta del Sol area where the restaurants are plentiful. We would certainly recommend this establishment.
